review:
eyyyy
kanye and jay put together a nice album some of the songs i like more than others but that is usually the case with albums
i kind of wish i had other songs like ham on it but it is what is
solid album
gets me going
the vinyl skips on a few songs as reported by other buyers
great
the greatest collaborative ive ever heard from any duo

i didnt listen to this until two years after its release despite liking all of kanyes music im not really a big jayz fan and that is why i avoided it  also that summer had other big releases bad vs evil and carter iv

but once i started listening to it i was floored this is an example of what can happen when two heavyweights team up and have any producer they want to work with every song sounds different but they all blend together to make an incredible piece of work

lyrically its a fair amount of bragging but lets be honest these two can get away with it that being said there are also some good raps with good substance in here too and that is the difference between a 4 star and a 5 star album the difference between something that sounds really hot today and an album that is a classic

key_phrases.Text: bad vs evil and carter iv

its a good cd but not great standout track is probably ns in paris

great album came in on time and this is perhaps a great and amazing collaboration album between kanye and jay simply great packaging and amazing sound quality on this album perhaps one of my top favorite albums for now a must buy

review: this album is a beautiful collaboration between two of the best artists ever this album should definitely get a sequel or something kanye and jz should do make another collab

key_phrases.Text: a sequel or something kanye and jz

review: is it jay or yes best album no is it better than most other albums even still yes its commercial for jayz standards a lot of the songs are radio friendly but the lyrics are still there jayzs workplay is still second to none kanyes production genius and his witty wordplay is still prevalant it has replay value while im not wowed by it because i know theyve been better its definitely worth having in my collection plus i still buy cds especially from them for the album art and they rarely disappoint the album art in the deluxe cd is phenomenal
like order i will order again if needed it was a gift for my sister its great purchase thank you
great music for all jayz and kanye fans  if you havent bought it yet get it and have their best

first things first although they were good i usually skip the singles otis n in paris no church in the wild when i listen to the album now due to hot97 playing them a million times a day the rza produced new day is one of the gems on here they talk about their future kids then on thats my b finds jay spitting some interesting lines about the lack of black females in the art museum other bangers are murder to excellence gotta have it welcome to the jungle and why i love you which seems like hes taking shots at beanie sigel watch the throne ended up better than i thought it be lift off was terrible horrible rapsinging by kanye and a forgettable jay verse primetime and illest m alive were joints i could not get into but nonetheless the album was enjoyable 4 stars

key_phrases.Text: a forgettable jay verse primetime and illest m

review: i brought this cd before i saw both jayz and kanye west in concert in dc a few months i love this cd especially when i am angry great music regardlessbe a believer and watch the throne
what can i say i love this album but the shipper suckedi didnt even get my gift note but anyway kanye and jay z are awesome d

this lp really pushing the culture forward  the music  lyrics are so on point  this is art  this is one of the top lps of the past few years  this lp was well thought out that is really missing in hiphop

make no mistake about it this is a concept album there have been really great ones in rock but not many in this genre this is a very well thought out and creative concept album about the fame legacy persona and personal life of two mega black hip hop moguls every song connects and not always smoothly but thats life i really love the jagged and unexpected moments that this album offers this is definitely a big picture cd those looking for lyrical genius hype beats and technical rapping skill will find it here and there but thats not what this album is about and so it may go over the heads of many theres really nothing like this out there right now

key_phrases.Text: two mega black hip hop moguls

review: jay z carries the collaboration steps up lyrically beats at time seem over produced kanye complains his way through the album seems to have lost his creative flair since he is so concerned that now everyone hates him because his actions have lead everyone to hate him needs to get over himself

i really like this album  it may not have a lot of singles but it is very solid throughout the entirety of the cd it is rapsnbspa datahookproductlinklinked classalinknormal hrefchinesedemocracydpb0037bbkikrefcmcrarpdrvwtxtieutf8chinese democracya very good all the way through  albums today are not made like that anymore  it seems to be more about the single than it is about album quality  this is quality through and through you are really getting what you paid for

keep the industry alive

i missed what was wrong with the album i have listened to it five or six times now i like all sixteen tracks no its not perfect but what album is to me it seems as if both kanye and jay z are charged and enjoying each others company as they trade verses over outstanding production jay z is far more interesting in my opinion when he shares the stage with the likes of kanye west who is decadent and bombastic i often find jay z to be a bit bland monochromatic if you will on many of his albums on watch the throne kanye pushes jay z to loosen up a bit take some chances and get back to his formal glory and he certainly does so kanye west proved with his last album my beautiful dark twisted fantasy that he has no peers in hip hop today and while this album isnt as good as that its still worth five stars
beautiful cover  intriguing concepts  otis is a modern masterpiece  this song will sweep the charts and awards  im looking forward to an album of otis remixes

its okay

did i expect more  absolutely especially given who was involved i thought this was going to be something epic  from beginning to end i found it to be more of a kanye west albumbe it left over tracks that didnt make the cut for my beautiful dark twisted fantasy or a followup to that albumand jay just hopped on last minute  seemed like jay was on this for sympathy this just seems like another kanyemotivated vehicle to resuscitate his wanning popularity since 808s  heartbreak

the album does flow  the tracks are decent but again with these being the two biggest names in hiphop today i thought this was going to be the second coming or something  both have the ability to falter on certain tracks i find kanye to be more lyrical and in his element and less just flat out stupid and uninspiring as most of his lyrics postgraduation on tracks better suited for conscience rappers like new day and the joy over jay  jay however remains supreme and shows kanye how its done on just about every other track from nas in paris to thats my bitch

lift off is by far the worst track on this album  i dont know whose bright idea this was

id give it 35 stars if amazon allowed that  it youre fans of both curious or just believe in hype then this is definitely for you  if not dont bother  since there is nothing else out really rap wise i guess this will have to do for now
half of the digipack arrived crushed but disc was fine im only mentioning this because cd was new other than that im happy with purchase
one of my all time favorite albums a must have for any hiphop lover
